intro: Hieracium elongatipes, commonly known as the elongated hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is considered a perennial species, often found in meadows and along roadsides.
